I took the Lumix DMC-FHK20K on my 50 day cross-country trip, and my older 7 MP Kodak camera took better outdoor shots as well.  This is my second attempt with the Lumix brand, and it will be my last.  How is Kodak going bankrupt?  I have taken many great shots with their cheaper cameras.  Never again Panasonic Lumix!!

Reviews.Title: CHEAP Materials = Bad Camera
Reviews.Author: Brett Buffum
Reviews.Content: After having my Canon PowerShot S110 Digital ELPH for over 10 years I was finally ready to upgrade.  I researched the heck out of the newer digital, small, point and shoots and finally settled on the Lumix FH20.  I liked the size, the MegaPixels, but especially the massive optical zoom.  I liked the camera so much we bought two, one for me and one for the wife.We've had them six months now, and mine is resting in the trash with a broken lens mechanics issue and the wifes has a nice piece of ducttape covering the hole where the battery and memory card used to live.As evidenced by the ten year history with the Canon I am not hard on my things.  This camera (Lumix) was done in by an accidental drop of two feet onto a tile floor while on.  The camera immediately had a black screen when in camera mode and would not take pictures anymore.  You could hear something rattling inside.  After reading about fixes for this, I ended up taking it apart.  What I found was a completely plastic camera (except for the glass of the lens itself).  I have now read that Panasonic is famous for being cheaply built, and unfortunately I learned the hard way.  The Canon was a tank.  This Panasonic is barely more than a toy.The wife's camera?  She had it in her purse, pulled it out one day, no more battery door.  It had opened itself and snapped off.The camera takes nice photos, is easy to use and looks great...but who cares when it is a cheaply made time bomb waiting to blow at any moment.  DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA IF YOU INTEND TO USE IT....IT IS NOT MADE FOR REAL LIFE USE.

Reviews.Title: Best Price is Costco
Reviews.Author: Love Lumix FH20
Reviews.Content: The BEST PRICE for Christmas is at COSTCO. You get the entire camera kit with battery, case, sdhc card and charger.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix
Reviews.Author: Mariell J.
Reviews.Content: I like the photos it took, but they tended to be either too much in the red spectrum for most of the photos I took, or a few were a weird greenish color.  I prefer the blue spectrum, because it's easier to fix if needed.  Red is harder and green is the worst.  Get a different camera.

Reviews.Title: Below average quality.
Reviews.Author: Beamer
Reviews.Content: I was not very impressed with the quality. The camera had a cheap light plastic feel to hold. Difficult to get a steady shot. Broke easily.

Reviews.Title: Great videos, but harder to use than the older model!
Reviews.Author: allston1971
Reviews.Content: This model is not as user friendly like the older model I had, the screen is smaller and fuctions are harder to use, but it takes great picture and better video than my video cam !

Reviews.Title: Worth it!
Reviews.Author: ASRORBEK TOSHEV
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, because it was on "a deal of the day". The seller was woot "fulfilled by amazon.com". They forgot to mention that it was factory refurbished, but it came with case, "Panasonic" branded 2GB SD card and you can't tell it's refurbished, unless you see the label on the camera saying so.I bought 2 of this, one for myself, the other for the gift, as I didn't know it was refurbished. But the camera works fine and is far better than the cameras on this price range..

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: beckyg
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful.  Takes great pictures and even my husband finds it easy to use.  Works like a dream.

Reviews.Title: awsome camera
Reviews.Author: Marsha
Reviews.Content: This camera was a great buy!! Clear pictures, and easy to carry around. Works great with my i-ecko 4gb sd card!

Reviews.Title: Missing free SD card and carry case
Reviews.Author: sunitha reddy
Reviews.Content: The reason i got this from Amazon vs Costco was because Amazon had a free 4 gb SD card and a carry case. I didn't receive neither. But overall the camera seems to do a good job.I may return it if they don't mail the 2 items within 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: thirstyfortechknowledge
Reviews.Content: I did my research, went to some stores to try different cameras and this was the best point and click I found.  Extremely easy to get a good, clear picture.  Sometimes you have to manually set the lighting type, but in general the camera chooses the best options for the environment. We haven't gotten the claimed 300 pic's on one battery charge, but we don't tend to take many pic's before turning it off, so the large powering on to pic's taken ratio probably has something to do with that.

Reviews.Title: I just love it!
Reviews.Author: Dario Raudales
Reviews.Content: I had and old camera, so I think it was time to get a new one, it took me a while to finally make my decision (you know there are plenty of models and brands) but the 8x optical zoom and 14mp was the best offer I could find by that price, of course, the cheapest is not always the better, at least that was I thought when I order it, but once it arrive I take it back, the quality is perfect, a way better than many cameras I had seen, the zoom is great, the interface so friendly and the design is awesome. The stabilized is Ok, the battery last enough for a day (or even more) and the screen is so good. I cant believe the price and features of this cam, I just love it!

Reviews.Title: Good little point n shoot for the money
Reviews.Author: Paul A. Rutherford
Reviews.Content: Good camera for a point and shoot.  When I set it for sending pics on e mail it still is very large and takes quite a while to load.

Reviews.Title: It's okay.  Didn't last long, though.
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift from my parents about a year and a half ago.  I needed something to replace my old Kodak EasyShare DX7630, a bulky, 6MP, 3x zoom camera I got back in 2005 that still works with the exception of the menu navigation system, which made the camera a pain to use since I couldn't go back and delete pictures to free up space on my card.My first impressions of the FH20 were that the camera fit nicely in my pocket and the menu was fairly easy to figure out, but the battery cover was very flimsy and much too easy to accidentally open.  In fact, only about a day after I got it, I dropped the camera on my carpet and the battery cover snapped off-- not at the hinges, but right through the plastic next to the hinge.  I fixed it with super glue and all was well, but since then pieces of the battery cover have flaked off through normal in-and-out-of-pocket use.  That's disappointing.What I do like about the construction is the On/Off and Camera/Review switches.  They are very simple and easy to use and I got used to them very quickly.  I also like the panel covering the USB connection-- the cover here is actually sturdy (doesn't open unless you want it to) and aesthetically appealing.Now on to image quality.  I am by no means a photographer, nor do I speak photgraphese or own a DSLR or anything.  I am a college student, and I enjoy bringing back quality photos of scenery from my travels.  I took my old Kodak to Luxembourg in 2010, and I took my FH20 to Greece in 2011.  Not caring much for making large prints but rather images I could display on my 22" monitor, I kept my Kodak photo resolution to 3.1MP.  When I got my FH20, I set it to 3MP because I liked the resolution and could fit a large number of photos on my 2gb card (the largest size my kodak would read).  What I found was kind of disappointing, however.  Even though they were nearly the same size photos, my old Kodak produced photos of better quality-- I found that the FH20 photos were less sharp in comparison.  The FH20 didn't perform as well in low lighting as the Kodak did, either, but it -did- do better than the Kodak in bright, natural light, producing accurately colored, highly detailed photos.  I did bump up the resolution to 12MP to test it out, but I could still see the same lack of sharpness in the images that I had enjoyed in my Kodak's photos.Now some more bad stuff.  I noticed quickly that the FH20 had some distortion near the edges of its photos-- that fish eye-like effect that elongates subjects near the corners of photographs.  This didn't happen with my Kodak, and I was upset to see it in the FH20.  About 8 months into owning the FH20, the camera started to be unable to focus on objects when zoomed in, no matter how close or far the subject.  I would have to focus zoomed entirely out, then zoom in slowly and refocus after each zoom.  Then about 10 months in, some dust or something got between the lens and I perpetually had a dark spot in the upper right center of my photos, which drove me mad because I was on the beautiful coast of Maine.  Then the lens cover started to get stuck and wouldn't retract fully when the lens was extended.  Finally, after a year, the lens started not extending when turned on, and I would have to try a few times to get it to work.  Within a month, however, the lens would not extend at all, rendering the camera useless.  I tried some more common, do-it-yourself fixes, but none of them worked.  I considered sending it in to Panasonic anyway, but after reading about their pretty awful customer service in regards to fixing things like this (and the amount I'd have to pay), I decided against it.  Now I have a non-functioning, beat up camera after less than a year and a half.

Reviews.Title: Great!!!
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to go into detail or anything, just wanted to say that I'm very pleased with it! If you're thinking about buying one, I recommend Panasonic all the way!!

Reviews.Title: Behave cheap
Reviews.Author: Shiblee Sadik
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading numerous good reviews about this camera and I used it for a month.Pros,1. Picture quality is great2. Auto focus works 75% of the times3. Take good photos of moving objects4. Reasonable video quality5. Flash recharges almost instantlyCons,1. It freezes frequently,2. It looks cheap and fragile3. Horrendous and irritating Panasonic customer support or no support at all4. Poor quality night (low light) photos

Reviews.Title: THIS CAMERA IS HORRIBLE!
Reviews.Author: Kailee K
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last year for my mom for Christmas and I wish I never had, it was the biggest waste of money! I spent about $200 on it and I thought for $200.00 I would be getting a nice camera that would take nice, quality pictures, boy was I wrong! All the pictures come out with a very dramatic orange tint and the pictures look awful. I thought maybe it was the  camera settings but I have tried every setting to get a different outcome and it doesn't matter which setting I am on the pictures have the orange tint! I don't understand why they turn out that way, I wish I would have returned the camera right away but I didn't. I will never recommend a Lumix to anyone and I will never buy another one again it was the biggest waste of $200. I bought it for my mom to upgrade from her Kodak Digital Camera that she bought when digital cameras first came out and that one is probably ten years old and takes better pictures!

Reviews.Title: camera does not  last
Reviews.Author: Stephen G. Cart
Reviews.Content: I bought the Panasonic DMC FH-20 camera for my daughters birthday. she loves to take picture as most college girls seam to. After 4 mo. the camera stopped working. the lens would not retract and the camera would not take pictures any longer. I have sent it in to get a replacement hopefully the new camera will work. i would be caution any one buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality in medium to low light
Reviews.Author: E. Low
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a year now and I've tried nearly all settings to compensate for the poor quality photos.  I have failed.I'm used to mediocre performance from point and shoot cameras, this has typically been a trade-off for the compact size.  However, now that a friend's iPhone has consistently taken better photographs than a dedicated camera, I see no reason to continue to own such a device.  I'm not a big fan of camera phones, but if a device that does NOTHING else cannot serve that function better than a devices that does a dozen things, it is without purpose.At this point, I think I'm just going to trash this camera (or give it away) and buy a DSLR or comparable and perhaps upgrade my phone.  Phone for candids, better camera for when I want really good photos.An entry level digital camera really has no purpose these days and I'm finished.

Reviews.Title: Speed and Quality - Give or take
Reviews.Author: Luke Bunker
Reviews.Content: I received this camera, kept it for a few days after taking lots of photos on lots of different settings with it, and then returned it.A few thoughts on it...The flash and shutter speed are both fantastic for a camera at this price range.  That being said, you will not get great photo quality with this.  Perhaps I went into this purchase expecting too much, but it did not deliver up to my expectations and I returned it shortly afterwards and purchased a DSLR.On that note, if you're looking for DSLR-quality images, take my advice and just make the jump - I'm SO glad I did.  The Nikon D3100 is a great starter camera and has given me speed and quality in one package.Bottom Line:  If speed is more important to you than image quality, then this is probably a great camera for you.  If, however, you want a combination of both, this camera is probably NOT a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: With cameras, you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: L. A. Wayte
Reviews.Content: I researched this a lot, but am ultimately disappointed (especially now that the camera broke after only 5 months). Even when it was working, the picture quality was only so-so, with the autofocus only working effectively about 1/2 the time. Also, not having zoom when video is running is annoying (video quality itself is much better than picture quality, though). Also annoying is that it takes several clicks of small buttons to switch from still photo to video mode. Why can't there just be one dedicated button for that switch of functions? Next time, I'll spend more to get a better camera . . .

Reviews.Title: Reviews
Reviews.Author: Howard Snyder
Reviews.Content: After spending about 30 hours researching cameras in the Under $150 range, and checking Comments I have come to a conclusion: Camera manufacturers have confederates who write in glowing reviews. And the Competitors have people that write in opposing views. I have seen nearly identical comments on every camera manufacturer's site, on every model. Such as "It broke when I took it out of the box; No customer support or replacement; This camera does not shoot as well as my ($700) SLR; Not as good as my 5 year old model; The lens would not retract and it was not covered by warranty; Buy the XX Camera instead (Which is 1 or 2 hundred MORE $ than the camera in question); or the classic fool that just states, DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA!".The best thing to do is pick a few cameras that sound good, and actually go look at them in a store and check them out firsthand. My buddy, a professional photographer, had the funniest advice, "Buy it at a store and get the extended warranty- and if it breaks or, whatever-ya-hate-it, drop it off a cliff, and take the pieces back to the store in a baggie, and get a new camera".

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FHC20
Reviews.Author: arismendy tejada
Reviews.Content: I buy this product and exactly what I expected. I arrived at the agreed time and price compared to other suppliers is pretty good. I recommend this supplier.

Reviews.Title: Camera shuts off!
Reviews.Author: DanD
Reviews.Content: In general the camera seems pretty good.  It takes nice pictures.  However, mine seems to have a mind of it's own.  It regularly shuts itself off for no reason. I often am just about ready to take a picture and everything goes blank.  If I then partially press the picture button things come back on but the camera acts weird with the lens zooming itself back and forth and then the camera may or may not shut itself off again.  Bottom line is that I have missed several good picture taking opportunities because of the camera's behavior.  I also do miss not being able to handle the camera one handed because of its smaller size and it being slippery holding on to.If I knew how to return it I would.  Have tried but have no idea as to how to get any help from panasonic in regards to why the camera seems to have a mind of its own.

Reviews.Title: photo quality poor
Reviews.Author: Cherie577
Reviews.Content: Too bad that this camera can't take a nice crisp photo--- I spent all weekend trying it out and not a single crisp photo.  I really like the use of the camera, but I want clear pictures.

Reviews.Title: piece of ####
Reviews.Author: Monty B. Earl "builder"
Reviews.Content: I use it every day to record photos for construction site, or I did.  It stopped retracting fully within a couple of months, managed to limp it along for a year and it quit altogether. I took as good a care of it as I could.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Henry Butler
Reviews.Content: First thing I noticed was that the camera takes a "specialized" battery & not a general type.  Took a few picture & made a video.  All controls were accessed electronically, not by simply pushing a button.  Didn't care for that.  Not pleased with the quality of either the pictures or the video.  This was a surprise, since I read this camera was supposedly the camera of the year.  Cannot recommend.

Reviews.Title: Fatal flaw
Reviews.Author: El Dorado Dave
Reviews.Content: We purchased our Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 a little over three months ago and were intially pleased with the features, ease of use and photo quality. However, we soon began to notice a very thin straight vertical line that runs from top to bottom through many -- not all -- of the photos we take with it. Very disappointing!I wanted to like this camera so much that I tried to convince myself that it was just a strange random thing, but unfortunately it has appeared in enough of our photos to know that it is definitely a problem with the camera. Not sure if it's a problem with the lens or the electronics, and I suppose I should experiment more with the settings to see if it only appears when we use the "intelligent auto" setting which is what we use nearly all the time.  Regardless, it's really not acceptable and it doesn't seem reasonable that I should have to spend time messing around with the camera to see if there's certain settings, lighting conditions, etc. that cause the line to appear. I actually came to Amazon to see if I could find another reviewer who's experienced the same problem, and thought it would only be fair to warn other potential purchasers about what we've experienced.I have not yet attempted to contact Panasonic about repairing or replacing the camera, and frankly if it were possible I'd rather just have my money back and purchase another camera that won't add lines to my photos.

Reviews.Title: Muy buena cámara para usarla a diario.
Reviews.Author: EduCast
Reviews.Content: Muy buena por precio, calidad, ergonomía y marca. Tengo puesta una tarjeta de 16Gb y anda muy bien.Recomendada!!!

Reviews.Title: Fragile - and no don't expect warranty repair with any sign of use
Reviews.Author: Repairman
Reviews.Content: I bought this for high optical zoom and decent price.- nothing special in picture qualityI dropped the camera and the zoom would no longer work right.- and after getting an RMA and shipping the camera in, they will not fix it under warranty. Any sign of "damage" voids all warranty.I have dropped my previous canon powershots and never had one fail like this frail camera.Last Panasonic for me.

Reviews.Title: I hate it
Reviews.Author: Sandy Langley "tomantique2002"
Reviews.Content: Before I bought this camera I had my beloved floppy disk digital Sony mavica for years. Then I went to a Olympus SP 500 UZ. Selling online and needing closeup pics and action pics of family are what I use my cameras for mainly. I have wasted WAY TOO MUCH TIME IN THIS PAST YEAR trying to get good closeups' colors and details with this Panasonic. This morning I can actually say I hate it!  The bluriness problem of digitals continues with this one. Costco salesperson said this was the best for what I used it for in the digital price range I was looking in when I told him I did not like the bluriness with my Olympus. If this is the best there is I would hate to see the worst. Every online thing I try to get enough good up close pics takes over an hour like this morning just for one pin! I am probably the cause but this is not a user friendly camera FOR ME for what I need so I am so frustrated I am taking the time to tell  you to check it out before buying it. Not bad for Florida beauty shots but argh for the online selling and bluriness. In fact I am so disgusted I am firing up my ol Sony til I decide what to do. Too late to take this one back.

Reviews.Title: Average
Reviews.Author: Lucky
Reviews.Content: Hi,I bought this camera couple of weeks back and i have been using it since then. I bought this camera as my friend recommended this.His camera is working fine. But i am not happy with this piece as i am facing problems like: keys are not working good and sometimes the screen is hanged.When i am trying to take  pictures one after the other it is not letting me to take next picture as the screen is hanged.I spent lot of money and finally got a defected piece.I am completely dissatisfied with my purchase.I don't know what to do with this product.. I expect the seller to test the product before sending it to the customer

Reviews.Title: Note lack of instruction manual and SD card.
Reviews.Author: R. Banziger "Rocky Road"
Reviews.Content: Just received my Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 digital camera as it was well recommended by consumer's report and has 8x optical zoom in a small package. I eagerly read the instructions that came with it, only to find it only tells how to charge, and the most basic use of the camera. The rest of the instructions have to be downloaded and printed out or set at the computer and read OR to order, what should have come with the camera, the cost is $35.00 plus shipping and tax: wonder if that includes handling?! This is a complicated camera with many features. One would want to be able to use the features so the instructions are important. I was told by Panasonic personal they had gone "green" and that is good except the instructions include 143 pages of paper and ink, NOT "green" for the buyer, only "green" for Panasonic. I believe they owe me $35.00. Some of my full page instructions are printed on two sides to save paper but now a mess to read. Yes, I tried to cut them down with no luck. Some of the printed pages have only 1/3 of space used. I now have a 1/2 inch thick, one(1)pound set of instruction. No kidding! How handy is that? For Panasonic to do the same would be much "greener" and cheaper for all, and much easier to use. I did not see anything in description that they were not included.This is an important point and if the camera is not as good as it should be I am really out!  Hope this helps and I believe that all their products are most likely the same way. "Green" remember. Also it does not come with an SD-card and does not say so in the information. I believe all technical info. should be included with all electronics.This is why we have to get the government involved in everything these days for those of you who do not like it, speak out.Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20K 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: not all computers will download pictures from this camera
Reviews.Author: grammy
Reviews.Content: After much research I settled on this camera .It arrived quickly and I immediately charged the battery and started taking pictures.Can't tell you how it works because have spent the rest of the day trying to download pics. to my computer! Phone number not answered. E'mail inquiries may take several days for an answer.Kicker is - in small print inside the manual- it mentions that some computers do not work with Lumix.

Reviews.Title: Could have been the best ever point and shoot, but
Reviews.Author: wayne scarpaci "wayne"
Reviews.Content: This camera could have been the best ever point and shoot, but the lack of a viewfinder and the lack of adequate contrast and brightness on the LCD display in full sunlight takes this camera from 5 plus plus stars down to 3 stars.....Other than this it is a great camera......Revised review: the software provided with this camera is horrible it took over 38 minutes to down load the current version from panasonic and it also does not work at all...I downloaded 54 5mb image using windows explorer and it took 34 minutes to download them....My canon A501 took less than 30 SECONDS to do the same thing...I gonna send this pile back and buy another canon....I cannot understand all the glowing reviews this camera has gotten...I would rate the camera at 3 stars and the software at MINUS 5 stars......21 Nov: I have decided to return this camera and buy a canon......I call panasonic's so called 'tech support', first of their voice activated teleprompter sent me to the bluray dept...Then the phone connection to the camera dept was so bad I could not understand the very unknowledgeable tech half the time...Then he doesn't know if my software is compatible with theirs and puts me on hold for 10 minutes while he finds out...then he still doesn't know and tries to give me (very garbled) directions to reload the software, something I had already done 3 times...In a word the my entire experience with this company has been very amateurish more befitting a 'garage shop' operation rather than an international corporation....Do yourself a favor and save yourself all this grief and buy a canon..my previous camera was a canon and I never had any problems with it or the software.....Oh and I rate panasonic's tech support at MINUS 5 stars as well

Reviews.Title: what a great camera!
Reviews.Author: Paulette Washington
Reviews.Content: this is an exceptional camera.  it takes beautiful pictures and videos and is crazy easy to use.  the only thing i would strongly suggest is to purchase the camera ANYPLACE ELSE THAN AMAZON.COM!  there customer service sucks as well as there shipping

Reviews.Title: I just didnt like it...
Reviews.Author: Island_girl
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, and was really excited to receive it. But when i actually got it i just didn't like it, the pictures looks a bit blurry and the camera is so light and feels very cheap, i had to return to amazon and i bought the sony cybershot W350 instead which is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Worthless
Reviews.Author: A. Aiad
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money. I had taken a better pictures with 7 MP Canon & 10 MP Nikon.The camera started freezing 1 months after I bought it.  I had to take out the battery to turn it off and restart. Panasonic tech support is a joke.

Reviews.Title: It's ok but Sony DSC - H55 is better
Reviews.Author: Serg "Serg"
Reviews.Content: When it come to choice I choose Sony DSC H-55 (14Mp, 10x optical). Optical 8x zoom is ok but if you go over that, than picture becomes noisy. There is no possibility to zoom in or out in video mode. You have to stop shooting then zoom in then start filming again. There is vertical stripes of indoor light and you can see it clear in the play back. So I would not use this camera for filming at all unless you do not care about quality. Pictures quality is ok, but sport mode does not work good. Without flash some pictures are blur some smashed. Indoor picture look a little overexposed. Well I saw other reviews here. They must be fans of this camera and if you like it on your own you may buy it.Good luck

Reviews.Title: PANASONIC BUILT TO FAIL
Reviews.Author: S. Chanen
Reviews.Content: This is my last purchase of any Panasonic still camera or video camera.  I have purchased five of them and none lasted more than 6 months.  I was lured by the Panasonic point and shoot digital cameras having such comparatively long optical zoom lenses, but obsolescence is built in, with these cameras built not to last more than 6 months. There is no need to suffer with Panasonic any longer as the other manufacturers have caught up with optical zooms on the digital point and shoot cameras.  There are two primary still camera manufactures: Nikon and Canon.  This applies to professional SLR's and consumer cameras.  If you don't believe me, look at any professional journalist.  You will not see a Panasonic or Olympus.  Go to any television station.  The pro equipment is all Sony.

Reviews.Title: Camera thoughts
Reviews.Author: Robert Brister
Reviews.Content: I haven't used it much yet, but from what I have seen so far it is superior to my previous camera, which is about 4 or 5 years old.

Reviews.Title: digital camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph W. Crespo "joe c"
Reviews.Content: its a camera, but do not like that you have to charge the battery. I would not buy this camera
